rules.description: If someone is in a room with a weapon and the door is locked, then forced entry is possible
If fingerprints of a person are found in a room, then that person was in the room
If a person has an alibi at a time, then they cannot be the culprit at that time
If victim is found in a room with blood stains, then murder occurred in that room
If noise was heard in a room at a time and victim found there, then murder happened at that time
If a person is in a room with a weapon and murder occurred there, then they are a suspect
If door is locked and no key found, then forced entry occurred
If person has alibi and is not in room, then they cannot be culprit
If murder location is known and person was there with weapon, then they used that weapon
If person is culprit and used weapon in room, then complete solution
Contradiction: Person cannot be in two rooms at the same time
Contradiction: Person cannot have alibi and be culprit at same time
If weapon is in room and person is in room, then person had access to weapon
If person had access to weapon and murder occurred in same room, then strong suspect

metadata.description: Propositional logic rules for Clue detective game
